content.description: This is a classic leaning arete problem and feels a little (hb), depending on where you start the crux is either low down or up high.
content.location: Located on the far, lower left hand corner of the Brick Wall formation.

content.description: A 60m rope is recommended, though not necessary. Start on the ramp at the right side of the rock and work up to an ugly crack. Veer left up a "dirty" section to a large ledge. Take the ledge to the left and climb up between two cracks. Finish on the left crack to the second horizontal crack (crux). Jam up to the top.

The 10c variation starts at the base of the bowl on the left side. It's an interesting smear problem, especially going over the top over the bowl. Approach the ledge via the crack pointing up at the triangular shaped roof. Move left and crank up the bulge (crux). Move up and right. Just below the nice ledge, you can move out to Living on the Edge (the face) for some more challenging moves. Otherwise, follow the crack up and left in the dihedral.

A 60m rope is recommended, especially if one wants to do the 10c bowl. Gain the ledge    directly below the triangular roof. Crank over via a tiny undercling, and then follow the nose straight up the    thin face to the ledge. Move slightly right after the ledge and follow the large crack. Lots of lichen on the    2nd half of the climb make it slightly annoying.

The Finn Assis is a great problem across the creek a short ways up canyon past The Brick Wall. Begin sitting on two bad granular crimps. Make moves up the arete to a slopey topout. Avoid the death flake.
content.location: This is a few hundred yards up canyon, past The Brick Wall, across the creek.

content.description: A 60m rope is recommended, though not necessary. Scramble up to the middle of the ledge below the face. Basically, start directly below the twin veritcal cracks 2/3 of the way up the rock. Go straight up the thin face, through these two cracks, traverse right, and then out via the large crack.
This nice block has classic problems ranging from V0 to V2 depending on eliminates.
content.location: This premium block of granite is located in the lower slope, just left of the Brick Wall formation.
